Comment: Honestly, it would require an entirely new framework for socioeconomic governance. Capitalistic democracy is inadequate, and communistic autocracy is wholly incompatible. I believe a monarchy founded on Catholic moral principles is the best way to organize a society.  Why?  1. Individual vs Community: Catholic social teaching declares that each individual human being is imbued with an incomparable dignity because we are all made in the image of God, our Creator. It upholds the individual‚Äôs right to private property, and also the community‚Äôs duty to care for the poor, the sick, the widow and the orphan.  2. Principle of Subsidiarity: Catholic social teaching upholds the principle of subsidiarity, that local community ought to be empowered to provide the governance of its citizenry, and only powers or provisions that can‚Äôt be reasonably relegated to the local government must be relegated to a state or federal government.  3. Justice and Natural Law: Catholic social teaching is largely predicated on natural law. Using natural law as a legal and judicial framework would ground society in moral truth that is conducive to human flourishing because it highlights the importance of the basic unity of society: the family. In other words, the culture wars of today would be resolved. No abortion, no divorce. The sanctity of matrimony is upheld. Justice seeks to rehabilitate the criminal, not exploit him through punishment.  The current framework is incompetent and inefficient because it has drifted away from what Western Civilization once was. This is a radical departure from the status quo, but Catholic monarchy was a successful way to organize society for over 1,000 years. It‚Äôs the departure from adherence to Christianity and into the maw of secularism that is to blame for most of the ills plaguing modern society, including poor resource management.
Author: Big_Iron_Cowboy
